6IKIqZBMAhUMEIT6WqX6hg.text: I did an online order and they delivered it in about 10 mins to Salud Cerveceria. They have vegan burrito options, which attracted us. Solid burritos that are very filling, though extraordinarily oily. Reasonably priced, fast and filling. Decent spot for a burrito or other Mexican fare.

n3xlnTi5uzxKT1BXpr-uRg.text: Finally a place to get decent empanadas! Flaky crust and flavorful fillings! I loved whatever the accompanying sauce too. Thank you! I will be back!

eIXshksgKt2ICF0gzgVwAA.text: Tried Sabor for the first time on Wednesday. It was so incredible!! Came back for lunch Friday!!  It's a great little hole-in-the-wall place with food that will blow your mind!  Service was great too. I'm so excited to go back again soon! The appetizer (can't remember what it's called) with french fries, steak, quack quacamole and a few more ingredients is outstanding!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Noda - Charlotte, NC, United States. A MUST TRY!! Appetizer with steak and french fries and so much deliciousness!!

CdXjQ4CPrA610zvCeaMvaA.text: Very trendy spot in NoDa that has become really popular. This place has great daily specials on food and beer ( bottles & draft). My favorite dishes here are the arepa and the empanadas. The arepa is definitely a meal within itself: fried corn-cake like sandwich with ample shredded chicken , cheese, and sauce inside. The empanadas are smaller, thinner pastry crust that's fried, but still delicious. I've also had the yuca fries which are awesome. Another neat thing about this place is the sauce station to the side. There are at least 7 varying degrees of intensity of sauces you can help yourself too. Very busy on Tuesdays ( $1 tacos).

TZ2Lyy4n1NNWUwmD8eDhXw.text: Ordered the corn on the cob, quinoa avocado bowl and arepa. The corn was so delicious and creamy with the right level of salt and cheese. Quinoa bowl was so tasty with a little bit of cilantro yogurt sauce. It was a very sumptuous healthy choice! Arepa was good, but had lot of cheese.

s6SF640D0m-12MIN3E5tIQ.text: Stumbled upon this place one night in NoDa and boy oh boy was I in for a treat. If you're looking for fast service, a good portion of food, delicious food of course, and a mean margarita, alllll for a super reasonable price. Sabor Latin Street Grill is the move. Loved this place! And honestly, it was perfect for a casual little date night, nothing fancy, just great food and good vibes.

ofHLo1giv6BG5uXOgP1uUA.text: One of my favorite taco spots. You can't beat the dollar tacos, beware it's only for the authentic ones. I'm more of an americanos fan because I like cheese and lettuce on mine. The nachos are huge and tasty. I also get their chips and salsa. It's been awhile since I e been because of the no where to park thing.

iGkJdiueN83K9hmzR08H-Q.text: Genius!  The perfect restaurant for the area.  Great quick food at reasonable prices.  I love the fact that they have avocado quinoa bowls now too, a great way to put something healthy on your stomach before I night out drinking.  I'm not gonna lie, I havn't been a fan of Cabo Fish Taco for quite some time.  The quality has fallen off a little, while wait is longer and longer.  So having another spot to get tacos is more than welcome.  Don't get me wrong, I will still go to Jack Beagles for a wrap or mac and cheese, I'll still go to Growlers for some apps, and I'll still go to Boudreaux's or the public house for a more sit down experience.  But all that said, this place serves a niche that has been needed to be filled for quite some time.  I guess I should talk more about the food and booze.  I started writing this assuming everyone had been to the other location.  This restaurant is part of the 3 Amigo's and Salud beer shop family.  Anybody looking for basic Mexican food should be able to find something to make their heart content, but there is so much more.  Think more Central and South American street food.  Arepas, gorditas, empanadas, as well as your basic tacos and burritos.  Everything is good and reasonably priced.  On top of all this, they have a great beer selection.  I mean REALLY great, like probably better than any other Mexican restaurant in NC.  Stone, Ballast point, and tons of local beers.  I'll be back, many times over and over.

0Ye32pKW4mvmz7wFkD-iKQ.text: The rice in my burrito wasn't even close to being cooked. After taking a bite and immediately noticing the poor quality, I politely asked the lady behind the counter to exchange, as the burrito wasn't edible. I was shocked when she told me that it wasn't a possibility since a bite had already been taken.   Bad food, even worse customer service. Save yourself the trouble and take your money elsewhere. Terrible.

TOM148cLkL-YVWA-ay1nnA.text: This place really destroyed my expectations. Came here for taco Tuesday which i wasn't expecting top of the line tacos but at least something edible. I got 2 chicken tacos and 2 beef. Food came out pretty quickly and the guy that made them was super nice. The food however was cold and he had just made them which I was very confused about. I decided to put my complaints aside and just ate anyway. I ate 1 chicken taco which was alright would've been a lot better if it was hot and fresh. I decided I wanted chips with my food so I went back up and waited about 5 solid minutes before I was attended to. I don't mind the wait but when the workers are just socializing and looking at me without letting the cashier know there is someone that needs help is just disrespectful. I decided to dig into the beef one and let's just say I don't know what I was eating. The beef had to be the worst I've ever tasted in my life. I have no idea how they are serving it. My tacos were replaced with all chicken but needless to say I won't be returning here. Absolutely no effort was put into the service so I'll just save my money.

F3Rpx8UX5rjOc2qr1vdGjw.text: Love love love Sabor! Skip Cabo and come here instead. Always friendly service, usually good looking too. And wash the tacos down with a mojito! Yum

cEZiF8VSyrZkSQg9-IGphw.text: I had a DELICIOUS lunch today! The food was so fresh, so good, and the service excellent!! Can't wait to bring my husband to the locations closer to home!!

OE8eAuLPhsyZcJNiHDvIQQ.text: We ordered online and pick up was for 7:33pm. My husband got their at 730 and didn't get our food until 7:55pm. When he received it, they forgot 2 tacos and 1 arepa. Luckily he checked or half of us wouldn't have gotten our meal. Finally got the rest of the food a few mins later. Horrible service considering we ordered ahead even. We were so excited about this place too. Bummer.

HR4gSDQyRy-DBNgiDW7quQ.text: My entire experience with this restaurant was phenomenal!! Everything was amazing. The food was very vibrant and tasty. The atmosphere was laid back and chill. From the cashier to the cooks to the bartender nothing but smiles and great quality of everything! I will continue to come here and recommend to everyone!!

k6Dc-zFKuuE8oqZgMyR-GQ.text: Hello, Sabor. Welcome to the new 'hood.   This new Sabor location is, IMO, a lot better than their Elizabeth one. Feels like there's twice as many tables/chairs, even though I'm sure I'm exaggerating.   As always, Sabor doesn't disappoint. $1 #TacoTuesday is the long standing real MVP. I just learned this, but they'll let you "upgrade" to the premium tacos for an additional $1 (thus, making the "premiums" $2/each).   I've tried all of the regulars, as well as the Al Pastor. Personally, I think the ground beef and shredded chicken are the best. I wasn't impressed with the al pastor in the least bit. I'm a queso kinda guy ... so this would be my "must improve" item for Sabor. I've gotten it 3 times, and 2 of the 3 times it's been extremely thin/runny. It always takes the same (I guess that's a plus), but I much  prefer it when it's thicker. The mo' cheese on a chip, the better.   Protip: Taco Tuesday is also valid for take out.

vK5cwtspG_w5NHxMCoBPaw.text: Absolutely awesome tacos on a Tuesday and I will keep coming back for them!!!  Great place to take out-of-town friends if in NoDa!
